entry.title: Basshunter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the song "Now You're Gone" by Basshunter (pictured) was played non-stop for 20 hours in a charity fundraising event?

entry.title: MetroHero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that MetroHero used to let riders know whenever the Washington Metro caught on fire?

entry.title: Heghnar Zeitlian Watenpaugh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an Armenian Apostolic Church lawsuit over the Zeytun Gospels led Heghnar Zeitlian Watenpaugh to write a history of its separated canon tables?

entry.title: Beulé Gate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the excavation of the Beulé Gate, a dynamite explosion sent a piece of mortar through one onlooker's hat?

entry.title: an Egyptian rabbi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an Egyptian rabbi's authority was invoked in a deed freeing a woman from slavery in 1132 in Mangalore, India?

entry.title: Kawa model (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Kawa model uses the metaphor of a river to help people contemplate their well-being?

entry.title: Paul Christiano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Paul Christiano founded the Alignment Research Center to align advanced artificial intelligence with human values and priorities?

entry.title: joking about the Chinese military (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that joking about the Chinese military can cost you US$2 million?
